titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. V:30. Missed the boat at 6—young Hopkinson came at ten— Walk in Count Survilliers Garden— Carré his Secretary. He gone grouse shooting— Missed seeing his pictures— Mrs. Adams ill, remains at Bordentown. Boat at 2, with Elizabeth, Jesse Deane, Mr & Mrs Alden, Blunt’s mother. Philadelphia at 7. Miss Shinn’s— Call at Hopkinson’s. Mary Hellen there— Meredith and Walsh— Philosophical Society Meeting— Invited to N. Biddle’s—did not go.

2. VI— Call on Genl. La Fayette— George and Le Vasseur. At Joseph Ingersoll’s— Examined the Depositions of Bruxner, Plessig and Cayley, under L. Harris’s Commission at St. Petersburg. Explanations— A new Commission to take my Deposition and that of G. Hay— Detained till too late. At the Boat at Noon— Call at Hopkinson’s. He gone to Bordentown— Messages from the Navy-Yard— Dined at C. J. Ingersoll’s with Dr. Chapman— Eve at Theatre. Preparations for Ball. Dallas, Strickland. Inscriptions. Mottoes.
Call at Hopkinson’s— With Mrs Chapman to Genl. Cadwalader’s— La Fayette there— Wright’s— Mrs Morris Bishop. White. Bollmann’s &c.

3. VI:30— Mr. Adams of Baltimore called and left last Evening’s Baltimore Patriot with me— Invitations to Secy. of State & Navy— With C. J. Ingersoll at Christ Church. Heard Bishop White. Psalm 73.25.26: Communion day. Wrote to P.U.S. With R. Peters and Dr. Jones of Georgia, out and dined at Judge Peters’s— Kersey, Quaker. Chestnut planted by Washington— Forsyth— Evening call at Mr Hopkinson’s— Sent for Mrs Adams, to Bordentown.

4. VI. Visits to the Institution for Deaf and Dumb— La Fayette there— Performances of the pupils. Mr Wells the teacher— Thence to the Hospital— Insane persons— Scott of the Phenix. Woman dying— Then to the Penitentiary. Passed through two lines of Convicts— Their aspect. Washington’s benevolent Society. Then to the Schuykill Water-works— Viewed the dam, and the wheels— Ascent of the Water— Visit to the Misses Bollmann at Mr Nickson’s— Then to the new Penitentiary now building— Then to the Orphan Asylum— Hymn sung— The widows. I left the Carriage in Market-Street. Found Mrs Adams at Mr Hopkinson’s— Dined with La Fayette at the Mansion House. Evening at the Ball at the Theatre— Went with R. Peters and the Ladies— Supper— Home with J. Vaughan between 1. and 2. A.M.

5. VII. Visit from Major Jackson. With J. Vaughan to the Academy of fine Arts. Diploma’s to La Fayette and his Son. To the Athenaeum with Vaughan— Thence to the State House. Hall of Independence. La Fayette. Children of
the Schools, passed in review 2250 Girls 1800 boys— Addresses— Banners— Song— Cadwalader’s Son in French. Hand-shaking— Call upon Ch. J. Ingersoll— At the dinner given by the Frenchmen to La Fayette. Duponceau presided— Plantou read an Ode— La Fayette left at 8. to go to Delaware— Evening at Mr Meredith’s. Music— Walsh. Vaughan Hopkinsons— Deane gone.

6. III. Visit from Gibbs— At Hopkinson’s— Mrs Adams concluded to go with me— Call on N. Biddle, with his brother’s papers— Rundle’s Schuylkill bridge— Banks. Steam-boat at Noon. Hopkinson’s with us— Captain Finch, Dr Sproston, Ogle Tayloe— Adams of Baltimore, in the Boat, and Stage from Newcastle at 5. Misses Wright. Reached Frenchtown 1/2 past 8— Invited into the Steam-Boat United States Trippe, by the Baltimore Committees of Corporation— Militia. Cincinnati— Morris. Hooper. S. Smith. La Fayette arrived after 1. A.M. Supper— Lodge in Ladies Cabin.

7. VI:30. Rose in sight of North Point— Four Steam-boats crowded came from the City to meet the “Guest”— Shouts and Cheers— Landed at Fort M’Henry, in barges— One rowed by 4 Sea Captains. Coll. Hindmann Jones— Macomb. Vandeventer— Tent of Washington. Address by Governor Stevens of Maryland— C. Carroll Howard. Revolutionary Officers— Pathetic. Collation— I went with Mr. Patterson in his Carriage to Barney’s tavern— Mrs Adams went on this morning with Mrs Southard, to Washington— With Barney to the City Council Chamber— Swan, M’Culloch &c. Address of the Mayor that was E. Johnson to La Fayette— Procession to the . . .ind in the Street Militia-review—very handsome. Dinner by the Corporation at Barney’s— Walk with Coll. Howard— Toasts dispensed with— Left the table with
La Fayette. Walk out to see the Illuminations. Met P. Little— Walk with him— Stopped in at Barney’s. His Electioneering friends—back by 10.

8. VI. Letter from C. W. Goldsborough— Breakfasted with La Fayette. He settled to go Monday to Calvert’s, and Tuesday to Washington— Stage at 8— Companions; two Carolinians, and an Irishman from Jamaica— Dined at Ross’s— Home 4. P.M. Mrs W. S. Smith with Mrs Adams who is unwell— Call at P.U.S—out. At Southard’s, out. He and G. Hay called at my house: With them to P.U.S— Arrangements for reception of La Fayette— Mrs. Monroe’s health, bad— Genl. Doughty— Call at Goldsborough’s, out— Walk with Southard home— Letter from R. Swartwout. Vice-Presidency— JacksonCalhoun—

9. VI:30.G. Hay here— Mrs Monroe’s ill health. C. W. Goldsborough here. Arrangements for La Fayette— To lodge at Gadsbys. Dr Thornton— At the Office— Addington— Baron de Tuyll—wishes to introduce Madam to P.U.S.— Alvear and Yriarté at the Office— Cabinet Meeting. Calhoun, Southard, Wirt— Reception of La Fayette— At House of P.U.S. with Members of Admn— Dinner—drawing-room. Foreign Ministers— French. South-American— Not to be invited. Slave-trade Convention— To be considered— Note from French Minister— Deserting Seamen— Southard dined with us and spent part of eve— Reading papers.

10. VI:30. Heard Little— T. Cooke with me. Prov: 23.23. Baker. Ezekiel 33.11. Little. Romans 12.1— Note from P.U.S— Call at his house— Question of admitting Ladies— Drawing room proposed— Visit from T. Ringgold. John wrote to Goldsborough. Reading papers. P.U.S. spoke of L. Harris, Mr Crawford. Alexander, and Jefferson.

11. VI:30. Visit from J. M’Lean— Mosher called, question about the drawing room. None to be held— At the Office. Scott. Mareuil— About La Fayette— Addington. Watkins. Presented Alvear to P.U.S. Speech in Spanish— Yriarté. Mosher present— Baron Tuyll at 2— Introduced Madam. P.U.S. remarks to Tuyll— At the Office again. Wyer: dined with us— D’Espinville and Laborie visits— Russians decline invitation for Thursday eve. Visit at Dr Thornton’s. [symbols]
12. V. By candle light— Washington— Reception of Genl La Fayette— Call at the Department. Arrived at 3. At P.U.S— Procession and military exhibition. Dinner at Gadsby’s— Eve at home.
13. VI. At the Office. Swan and Catlett— At P.U.S.Wirt there. Call on Genl. La Fayette. Visit from him— He dined at P.U.S— Eve at Genl. Brown’s. Dr. Thornton. C. F. Mercer— Slave-trade Convention.
14. VI.G. Sullivan here. Long conversation— Office. Papers. Dined at P.U.S. with Genl. La Fayette— Evening party at our house— Crowded and warm till Midnight

15. VI:30.Dr Staughton with Lockhart and another. At the Office. Invitations to Alexandria and York-town. Call on Judge Duvall at Dr May’s— His accident— Visit . . . the Navy-yard— La Fayette there— The Frigate and the Armoury— Old Soldier from Pittsburg. Collation at Com. Tingey’s. L. F. to Henderson’s— Home— Call at Sullivan’s, . . . here— Note from Brent— Calhoun goes to York town; urges me. I have declined.

16. VI:30.Calhoun, Hay & Harrison here— At the Office, and at P.U.S.Genl. Brown [symbols]— Hay goes to York-town. Dined at Alexandria— Arrived at 5— End of the procession— Public room— Washington Society— Speeches of G. W. P. Custis— Dinner. 100 persons. toasts— Death of Louis 18. announced— Home alone at 10. [symbols]

17. VIII— Heard Little. Luke 11.28— No afternoon Service at Baker’s— Dr Huntt. Judge Cranch dined with us— Dr Watkins and Captain Phillips here this eve. Letters. Brobson to Wa. . .. T. Finley & Kilear.

18. VI:30.Mrs Royall. M’Lean. Little. H. Lee. W. Cranch. English— At the Office— Lockhart, Hodgson, Southard and Addington. Of M De Neuville, & troops— Adml. Lake; and the Slave-trade Convention— Baker here, this Evening.

19. VI. Note from P.U.S. going to Albemarle. Office— Dr Thornton with Letter from L. Sawyer. Wyer. At P.U.S. Taylor for naval Office Philadelphia— Southard with Captn. Phillips— Letter to N. Edwards— Thornton. Watkins— Play at Carusi’s— G. Sullivan—

20. VII.B. O. Tyler. Major Jackson. Carbery— At the Office— Alvear—long conversation with him. Presented him and Yriarte to P.U.S. to take leave— W. Lee— H. Lee. P.U.S. at Office. Evening at Mrs Wilson’s— Douglas’s— Chess with Mrs Stone. Major Jackson dined with us.

21. VI:J. M’Lean, G. Taylor, Wyer, L. Sawyer, . . . and C. C. Biddle here— At the Office— Note, from Alvear— Hodgson— M’Lean with a Letter from Mower at Trenton. M’Intyre this eve, His disclosures. Dr Thornton’s— Writing. P.U.S. to Albemarle.

22. VI:30—B. O. Tyler— Wyer’s explanation— H. Lee. Crawford’s state of health. Lovell— My advice against this topic— At the Office.— Boughan for Marshalsea of Mississippi— Hodgson— Portuguese papers. G. Graham, boundary of Arkansas— Alvear and Yriarte took leave. Jery. Robinson; for settlement of Account, in Treasy.
23. VI:30.R. Smith and S. H. Smith— At the Office. Wyer— Bourne going to N. Orleans or Holland. Letter to R. Rush— Eve, Watkins— Force at Met Bank this day.
24. VI:30. Heard Little. Eccl: 7.16. Wood at Baker’s. Matthew 25. 14–30– Little Jer: 13.23. Thornton.

25. VI. At the Office— W. Lee— Name Register. Letter from Lenox, for Bank’s partner as Consul at Jamaica— My answer Maury— Letters from his uncle to come undercover to me. T. Munro—to recommend Kelty— His Son at Warsaw. Evening walk. G. Sullivan here—returned from Baltimore.
26. VI:30. Rain— At the Office— Wyer— Letter to Rush, M’Lean. Mower to Genl. Brown— Evening, Southard and Watkins— Kerr again. Ecce iterum Crispinus.
27. V.Rogers. D. Brent with . . ., Mann— Races—very poor— At the office, walk with Thornton— Custis. Hodgson— Wyer— Watkins— Johnson Hellen from R. W. Lee at eve—and Wyer.

28. VI:15.A. Scott. Parker. Dr Irving— G. Sullivan. Walk to race-ground— 2 miles heat— Wynn. Southard— Walk back with Ogle. Barnum: At the Office— B. Conner. Wyer— Ogle. Tayloe to dine. M’Intyre at eve. Journal publication— Events at Met. Bank.

29. VI:30. Note from Addington. At the Office. Addington there— Slave-trade Convention Powers. rode with Sullivan to the race— 4 heats of 3 miles. Foul play. Wynn— Wyer at the Office. B. Conner. Eve at home: reading papers— Cold. [symbols]
30— VII.30. Sleepless. Major Jackson— At the Office. Baker, for appointment at Trinidad of Cuba— Calhoun returned from Yorktown— Major Jackson dined with us. Johnson Hellen back from Rockville.
31. VI:30. Heard Little— Lamentations 3.22.23. and Exodus 20.3— Baker. James 1.12. J. S. Barrell dined with us— T. B. Johnson arrived. T. Watkins here this Evening— Philadelphia ch. . . of Electors—
